chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall Sigma : PropositionalVariables, Countable Var -> Countable (expr Sigma)

Premises:
Inductive expr (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) : Type := andp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | orp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | impp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | falsep : expr Sigma | varp : Var -> expr Sigma For andp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For orp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For impp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For falsep: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For varp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
Var = fun PropositionalVariables0 : PropositionalVariables => let (Var) := PropositionalVariables0 in Var : PropositionalVariables -> Type Argument PropositionalVariables is implicit and maximally inserted
Record PropositionalVariables : Type := Build_PropositionalVariables { Var : Type } For Build_PropositionalVariables: Argument scope is [type_scope]
Countable = fun A : Type => injection A nat : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
rank = fun Sigma : PropositionalVariables => fix rank (x : expr Sigma) : nat := match x with | andp y z | orp y z | impp y z => 1 + rank y + rank z | _ => 0 end : forall Sigma : PropositionalVariables, expr Sigma -> nat Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
sum_Countable = fun (A B : Type) (CA : Countable A) (CB : Countable B) => injection_trans (sum_injection CA CB) (bijection_injection nat2_nat_bijection) : forall A B : Type, Countable A -> Countable B -> Countable (A + B) Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
prod_Countable = fun (A B : Type) (CA : Countable A) (CB : Countable B) => injection_trans (prod_injection CA CB) (bijection_injection natnat_nat_bijection) : forall A B : Type, Countable A -> Countable B -> Countable (A * B) Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
injection_Countable = fun (A B : Type) (R : injection A B) (CB : Countable B) => injection_trans R CB : forall A B : Type, injection A B -> Countable B -> Countable A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
bijection_Countable = fun (A B : Type) (R : bijection A B) (CB : Countable B) => injection_Countable (bijection_injection R) CB : forall A B : Type, bijection A B -> Countable B -> Countable A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Inductive expr (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) : Type := andp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | orp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | impp : expr Sigma -> expr Sigma -> expr Sigma | falsep : expr Sigma | varp : Var -> expr Sigma For andp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For orp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For impp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For falsep: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted For varp: Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
nCountable_Countable : (forall n : nat, Countable (?A n)) -> Countable {x : nat & ?A x} where ?A : [ |- nat -> Type]
minL = fun Sigma : PropositionalVariables => {| Syntax.impp := impp |} : forall Sigma : PropositionalVariables, MinimumLanguage L Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
pL = fun Sigma : PropositionalVariables => {| Syntax.andp := andp; Syntax.orp := orp; Syntax.falsep := falsep |} : forall Sigma : PropositionalVariables, PropositionalLanguage L Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
unit_Countable = FBuild_injection unit nat (fun _ : unit => 0) (fun (a1 a2 : unit) (_ : 0 = 0) => match a1 as u return (u = a2) with | tt => match a2 as u return (tt = u) with | tt => eq_refl end end) : Countable unit
expr_rect : forall (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) (P : expr Sigma -> Type), (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (andp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (orp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (impp e e0)) -> P falsep -> (forall v : Var, P (varp v)) -> forall e : expr Sigma, P e
expr_ind : forall (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) (P : expr Sigma -> Prop), (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (andp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (orp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (impp e e0)) -> P falsep -> (forall v : Var, P (varp v)) -> forall e : expr Sigma, P e
expr_rec : forall (Sigma : PropositionalVariables) (P : expr Sigma -> Set), (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (andp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (orp e e0)) -> (forall e : expr Sigma, P e -> forall e0 : expr Sigma, P e0 -> P (impp e e0)) -> P falsep -> (forall v : Var, P (varp v)) -> forall e : expr Sigma, P e
L = fun Sigma : PropositionalVariables => {| Base.expr := expr Sigma |} : PropositionalVariables -> Language Argument Sigma is implicit and maximally inserted
Record PropositionalVariables : Type := Build_PropositionalVariables { Var : Type } For Build_PropositionalVariables: Argument scope is [type_scope]
Record SOR (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rplus rtimes rminus : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req rle rlt : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_SOR_theory { SORsetoid : Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req; SORplus_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rplus x1 y1) (rplus x2 y2); SORtimes_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> forall y1 y2 : R, req y1 y2 -> req (rtimes x1 y1) (rtimes x2 y2); SORopp_wd : forall x1 x2 : R, req x1 x2 -> req (ropp x1) (ropp x2); SORle_wd : forall x1 x2 : R...
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (...
Field_theory.AFinv_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI
Field_theory.pow_pos_nz : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall (x : R) (p : positive), ~ req x rO -> ~ req (Ring_theory.pow_pos rmul x p) rO
Ring_theory.ARmul_0_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul x rO) rO
Ring_theory.ARadd_0_r : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (radd x rO) x
Record semi_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_srt { SRadd_0_l : forall n : R, req (radd rO n) n; SRadd_comm : forall n m : R, req (radd n m) (radd m n); SRadd_assoc : forall n m p : R, req (radd n (radd m p)) (radd (radd n m) p); SRmul_1_l : forall n : R, req (rmul rI n) n; SRmul_0_l : forall n : R, req (rmul rO n) rO; SRmul_comm : forall n m : R, req (rmul n m) (rmul m n); SRmul_assoc : forall n m p : R, req (rmul n (rmul m p)) (rmul (rmul n m)...
Field_theory.field_is_integral_domain : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall r1 r2 : R, ~ req r1 rO -> ~ req r2 rO -> ~ req (rmul r1 r2) rO
Ring_theory.ARmul_1_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x
Ring_theory.ARadd_0_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x
positive_ind : forall P : positive -> Prop, (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~1)%positive) -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (p~0)%positive) -> P 1%positive -> forall p : positive, P p
Ring_theory.ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
InitialRing.same_genN : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Setoid.Setoid_Theory R req -> Ring_theory.sring_eq_ext radd rmul req -> Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req -> forall x : N, req (InitialRing.gen_phiN rO rI radd rmul x) (InitialRing.gen_phiN1 rO rI radd rmul x)
